definition: the Forbidden City/abbr. for 故宮博物院|故宫博物院[Gu4 gong1 Bo2 wu4 yuan4]
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
Palace Museum, in the Forbidden City, Beijing/National Palace Museum, Taipei
Mukden Palace, aka Shenyang Imperial Palace, the main imperial palace during the early years of the Qing dynasty (1625-1644), a secondary palace in subsequent years, now a museum

sentences.english: We call it the Fromer Imperial Palace now.
Jingshan Park lies right to the north of the Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 景山公园坐落在故宫博物院的正北。

sentences.english: The wind takes the form of the beast, the Imperial Palace of Beijing Taihe temple has this monster.
sentences.chinese: 嘲风形似兽，北京故宫的太和殿里有这个怪兽。

sentences.english: LIFE】A Chinese tourist steals a glimpse of the Palace Museum inside Beijing’s Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 一位游客偷偷张望北京紫禁城内的故宫博物馆。

sentences.english: It is said that that hour is the Imperial Palace gloom heaviest time.
sentences.chinese: 据说，那个钟点是故宫阴气最重的时刻。

sentences.english: Anyone who's visiting in Beijing ought to go and see the Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 不论是谁，只要到北京去游览，都应当去看看故宫。

sentences.english: The students excited are describing in Imperial Palace's that golden small tinkling bell throne.
sentences.chinese: 学生们正在兴奋的描述故宫里的那个金銮宝座。

sentences.english: Eventually you will come to Jinghsen Qanyie Road and the moat and wall of the Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 路的尽头就是紧靠故宫城墙和护城河的景山前街。

sentences.english: We'll go to Forbidden City today, the Great Wall tomorrow, and Beihai Park the day after.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天去故宫，明天去长城，后天到北海公园。

sentences.english: Located in the south of the palace, the south east ZhengYangMen outside.
sentences.chinese: 位于故宫正南偏东的城南，正阳门外东侧。

sentences.english: There is "ice play" painting by Qing Dynasty painter at the National Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 故宫至今藏有清代宫廷画师描摹的《冰嬉图》。

sentences.english: How far is it from Beijing Hotel to the Palace Museum?
sentences.chinese: 从北京饭店到故宫有多远？

sentences.english: The Danish teaching assistants visit Forbidden City and Temple of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 丹麦助教参观故宫博物馆和天坛公园。

sentences.english: We visited the Summer Place, the Forbidden City, Ming Tombs and many parks there.
sentences.chinese: 我们参观了颐和园，故宫，明十三陵还有好多公园。

sentences.english: I’d like to go to the Temple of Heaven and the Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 那我就上午带您去故宫，然后去天坛。

sentences.english: Shan Jixiang says they've found that Forbidden City culture is particularly popular in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 单霁翔说，他们发现故宫文化在香港特别受欢迎。

definition: Palace Museum, in the Forbidden City, Beijing/National Palace Museum, Taipei
the Forbidden City/the Imperial Palace in Beijing/same as 故宮|故宫[Gu4 gong1]
Mukden Palace, aka Shenyang Imperial Palace, the main imperial palace during the early years of the Qing dynasty (1625-1644), a secondary palace in subsequent years, now a museum
Yuanmingyuan, the Old Summer Palace, destroyed by the British and French army in 1860
the Ming tombs (mausoleum park of the Ming emperors in Changping district of Beijing)
Hall of Supreme Harmony, the largest of the three halls that constitute the heart of the Outer Court of the Forbidden City 紫禁城[Zi3 jin4 cheng2]
Tiananmen Gate, entrance of the Imperial City in Beijing

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Guo2 jia1 Bo2 wu4 guan3
